com.mesosphere.sdk.framework

Class OfferProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.framework.OfferProcessor

  • public class OfferProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles offer processing for the framework, passing offers to an underlying MesosEventClient, which itself represents one or more underlying services.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • OfferProcessor

        public OfferProcessor(AbstractScheduler abstractScheduler)

    • Method Detail

      • disableThreading

        OfferProcessor disableThreading()
        Forces the instance to run in a synchronous/single-threaded mode for tests. To have any effect, this must be called before calling start().
        Returns:
        this

      • setOfferQueueSize

        OfferProcessor setOfferQueueSize(int queueSize)
        Overrides the offer queue size. Must only be called before the scheduler has start()ed.
        Parameters:
        queueSize - the queue size to use, zero for infinite
        Returns:
        this

      • start

        public void start()

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue(java.util.List<Protos.Offer> offers)

      • dequeue

        public void dequeue(Protos.OfferID offerId)

      • awaitOffersProcessed

        public void awaitOffersProcessed()
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        All offers must have been presented to resourceOffers() before calling this. This call will block until all offers have been processed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if waiting for offers to be processed is interrupted
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if offers were not processed in a reasonable amount of time

      • declineShort

        public static void declineShort(java.util.Collection<Protos.Offer> unusedOffers)
        Declines the provided offers for a short time. This is used for special cases when the scheduler hasn't fully initialized and otherwise wasn't able to actually look at the offers in question. At least not yet.
